text: Cecil James Gilbert (5 May 1923 - 7 July 2016) was a Scottish television producer and director. He was the BBC's Head of Comedy from 1973â€“77. He was probably best known for his work on The Two Ronnies, Last of the Summer Wine and Open All Hours. In 2003, Gilbert appeared on the documentary special 30 Years of Last of the Summer Wine to discuss his role in helping to create the series. Gilbert died on 7 July 2016 in Scotland, aged 93. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2016 deaths Category:British television directors Category:British television producers Category:People from Edinburgh
title: James Gilbert (producer)
